requirements.description: Ability to establish a multi-entity structure with configurable financial rollups by region, subregion, and department.
Ability to create and manage departments, regions, projects, cost centers, and organizational reporting structures within a single legal entity.
Ability to add new subsidiaries/legal entities as sub-entities under an existing parent entity.
Ability to add, modify, or include account, department, region, subregion, project.
Ability to configure approval workflows for changes to the entity hierarchy.
Ability to modify the account structure and maintain account hierarchies.
Ability to control user access to posting attributes within the chart of accounts.
Ability to leverage GL account rollups for reporting and analysis.
Ability to create journal entries with appropriate description codes.
Ability to configure recurring journal entries (monthly, quarterly, annually) based on fixed or calculated values.
Ability to automatically post recurring journal entries on a defined schedule.
Ability to use templates for creating journal entries.
Ability to review and approve templates for recurring automated journal entries.
Ability to create and post manual journal entries.
Ability to attach supporting documentation to journal entries.
Ability to notify both the requester and approver when manual journal entries are posted.
Ability to integrate workflows for the review, approval, and adjustment of journal entries.
Ability to post journal entries to multiple entities in a single upload.
Ability to automatically flag and notify users of anomalies or discrepancies.
Ability to manage gl permissions by role, including tasks such as creating new accounts.
Ability to configure automated department, entity, or customer allocation rules (e.g., based on headcount, employee hours, customer square footage)
Ability to automatically reverse journal entries on a specified date.
Ability to create recurring accrual journal entries with reversal in the following period.
Ability to post journal entries in draft mode pending approval.
Ability to perform mass journal uploads using Excel or CSV templates.
Ability to post adjusting journal entries separately and identify them distinctly in reporting.
Ability to support statistical accounts for non-monetary data.
Ability to assign journal entry types or tags (e.g., standard, adjusting, reclass, accrual).
Ability to set journal entry posting limits by role/user.
Ability to allocate payroll labor costs (including burden, overtime, and incentives) to projects based on labor distribution rules or timesheet inputs.
Ability to restrict the creation of new projects and require approval.
Ability to setup fixed assets and intangible assets with assets identifier, Serial Number, Manufacturer,  Asset Class, Asset Type, Location, etc.
Ability to run fixed asset depreciation by company, asset class, or both
Ability to track when an asset is removed from service
Ability to report on assets by cost center
Ability to create depreciation and amortization schedules that depreciate or amortize assets monthly automatically
Ability to assign depreciation methods and useful lives by asset class.
Ability to generate Fixed Asset register with Asset Classes, Cost, Accumulated Depreciation, YTD Depreciation
Ability for the ERP to generate depreciation journal entries
Ability for the ERP to generate amortization journal entries
Ability to record purchases, transfers and disposals of assets
Ability to write off and dispose of assets
Ability to generate point in time depreciation and cost reporting during close process
Ability to manage intercompany fixed assets allocation
Ability to manage deferred tax asset and liability, as well as, deferred tax amortization
Ability to maintain separate books for tax versus book depreciation
Ability to maintain component/sub-asset relationships.
Ability to bulk update asset attributes
Ability to automate intercompany matching by counterparty
Ability for intercompany matchings to be approved by counterparty within the system
Ability to automate rejection notifications by counterparty to defined users
Ability to label intercompany accounts with transaction types that denote intercompany activity
Ability to tag supporting documentation against intra entity transactions (e.g. payroll download, invoices, etc.)
Ability to generate intra-entity matching reports
Ability to perform automated intercompany reconciliations
Ability to review consolidations automatically
Ability to view any intercompany report discrepancies before the GL closes to minimize variances
Ability to standardize input of invoice data related to expense allocation or other intercompany transactions
Ability for automated workflows for intercompany transaction approvals
Ability to perform multi-lateral netting intercompany transactions
Ability to automatically eliminate intercompany balances during consolidation.
Ability to create and track intercompany loans with amortization schedule
Ability to automate intercompany settlements and markup reconciliation between Kastle and CheckVideo (including schedule-based true-ups).
Ability to perform standard reconciliations through a systematic and automated process- accrual, prepaid, cash, AR, AP, tax payable and receivable
Ability to run account activity reports for all accounts in the GL for use for in preparing account reconciliations
Ability to run subledger account detail reports for use for in preparing account reconciliations
Ability to run subledger A/P reports to balance payables and validate the GL A/P balance as part of the A/P reconciliation process
Ability to run subledger A/R reports to balance receivables and validate the GL A/R balance as part of the A/R reconciliation process
Ability to certify reconciliations with preparer and reviewer sign-off.
Ability to maintain a complete audit trail of reconciliation changes.
Ability to map bank transactions in the GL and automate necessary journal entries
Ability to automatically match and reconcile bank transactions imported from the banks
Ability to load cleared AP checks to facilitate bank reconciliation
Ability to report on uncleared checks
Ability to record bank fees, bank transfers, interest income in an automated fashion from BAI2 file
Ability to manage the monthly close process including capabilities for creating checklists, assigning tasks, setting up workflow, and providing insight/visibility into the process
Ability to track close cycle KPIs
Ability of system to generate and post elimination entries
Ability to support an automated process for eliminating entries between companies so that consolidated financial statements can be produced.
Ability to establish elimination rules to facilitate consolidated reporting (i.e. intercompany sales/purchases, Due to/due From etc.)
Ability to consolidate financial results, post eliminating entries, and provide consolidated reporting
Ability to report on varying levels (i.e., Consolidated Company, state, etc.)
Ability to close various parts of the GL throughout the close
Ability to define and enforce financial close calendars with owner assignments.
Ability to automatically carry forward open tasks and checklist items.
Ability to support a rolling close approach with continuous subledger reconciliation
Ability to create financial statements - Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Statements of Cash flow
Ability to reconcile local vs US GAAP financials
Ability to run account activity reports for all accounts in the GL for use in reconciliations, analysis etc.
Ability to report on both consolidated and stand-alone Legal Entity financials
Ability to produce ad hoc financial reports – point in time (adjusted EBITDA, gross margin, etc.)
Ability to create and share ad hoc financial reports
Ability to review year to date financial reporting
Ability to review last twelve months (LTM) financial comparisons
Ability to have drill down capabilities in financial reporting
Ability to restrict access to specific financial reporting by user or user group
Ability to schedule recurring distribution of financial reports via email.
Ability to include commentary and footnotes in financial reports
Ability to export financials in multiple formats (PDF, Excel, Word, etc.)
Ability to report profitability by region, subregion, customer vertical, and project.
Ability to systematically create and modify customer account records with required validations and approval workflow.
Ability to integrate customer account creation and updates from CRM to ERP, without duplicate record creation.
Ability to update customer data in the ERP when changes occur in CRM, based on controlled and auditable rules.
Ability to validate new customer setup requests through approval workflow (Credit, Tax, Terms, Billing Preferences).
Ability to add and manage customer building / site locations independently from the legal customer record.

Ability to store key customer information
- Customer ID
- Entity
- State and county
- Billing Address
- Service address
- Contracts
- Contract Start and End Date
- Billing Rate
- Billing type
Ability to assign custom industry / vertical / compliance attributes to customers profiles.
Ability to maintain customer site / building locations and associate multiple projects to a single building.
Ability to establish Customer Parent/Child hierarchies to support complex ownership or management structures (property management companies).
Ability to enforce customer credit limits during order, project, and service activation processes.
Ability to establish a workflow for the systematic customer setup process, including customer credit and terms approval.
Ability to track sales tax-exempt customer status and manage certificate documentation.
Ability to maintain and update tax rates by state, county, and city.
Ability to integrate with an external tax engine to automatically calculate sales tax and manage exemption validation.
Ability to generate, store, and manage W-9 and compliance documentation as part of the customer record
Ability to tag and report on customers by based on various aspects such as sector, geography, etc.
Ability to track and manage customer payment terms and credit conditions.
Ability to report on credit exposure (open AR balance, sales orders, pending billing, payment terms)
Ability to automatically flag customers who violate payment terms or fall into at-risk credit status.
Ability to identify and prevent duplicate customer accounts based on configurable matching rules.
Ability to identify invoice delivery method on the customer account (i.e., mail, email, etc.)
Ability to maintain customer-specific billing format, language, remittance, and payment method preferences.
Ability to automatically hold work orders, scheduled services, or new project activation when customer is over credit limit.
Ability to define customer credit limits and automatically enforce them during sales/order processing.
Ability to maintain customer asset records and portfolio reporting
Ability to assign account manager or sales rep ownership and track changes over time.
Ability to synchronize contract data from CRM / CPQ to ERP without creating duplicate customer records.
Ability to create and assign a contract record to a customer profile
Ability to associate multiple contracts to a single building/site location.
Ability to create a Project or Service record automatically when a contract is marked as closed/won.
Ability to identify “contract ready”, “install pending”, and “service not yet activated” status values on the contract.
Ability to capture and version changes to contract rates, scope, or service levels with approval routing.
Ability to retain audit history of contract terms, rate changes, renewal events, and escalation adjustments.
Ability to support multiple billing methods per contract, including monthly recurring (RMR), quarterly, anually, usage-based, milestone, and time and materials.
Ability to modify contract terms (rate, term, SOV allocation, services included) with routed approval workflow.
Ability to capture and propagate blended recurring revenue (RMR) and escalators from CPQ through CRM to ERP
Ability to store contracts with searchable metadata (contract #, customer, building, renewal date, agreement type).
Ability to extract, store, and report on contract attributes including service levels, pricing terms, escalation clauses, and renewal options.
Ability to automatically generate contract renewal notifications and escalate contracts for review prior to expiration.
Ability to enforce automatic escalators (CPI %, fixed %, contract clause-based) at contract anniversary.
Ability to suspend billing when service is paused or building access is revoked, without canceling the contract.
Ability to terminate contracts mid-term and automatically prorate final billing.
Ability to integrate with the CRM to automatically create project records in ERP when an Opportunity or Quote is set to “Won”.
Ability to integrate with the CRM to automatically create a project using the quote’s pricing, estimated labor (hours and dollars), detailed parts (BOM) and expenses
Ability to set up project records with scope, estimated labor, estimated parts, customer site details, and scheduling readiness indicators.
Ability to create and link sales orders and projects from quotes and proposals for seamless project initiation.
Ability to restrict or require approval prior to creation of new project records.
Ability to link project records to customers
Ability to identify "assets" installed as part of the project and link assets to customer records
Ability to view all "customer Assets" in a centralized location
Ability to standardize project setup and execution using templates
Abilty to configure change-order workflows allowing multiple concurrent change orders
Ability to maintain original cost estimate for project, but also have updated versions of the estimated costs as the project progresses
Ability to record change orders with incremental cost and revenue impact tracked against the same project.
Ability to maintain and track project milestones efficiently, including revenue recognition and billing cycles.
Ability to track, update, and report on planned, budgeted, and actual hours for labor and resources
Ability to record project labor, parts, subcontractor costs, and miscellaneous expenses directly against the project.
Ability for technicians to enter labor and parts usage through Field Service, with costs flowing automatically to ERP for accumulation.
Ability to review and validate labor and parts entries prior to financial posting.
Ability to post invoices for project activities and materials directly against the project.
Ability to maintain a continuous project that remains open to capture ongoing cost until installation completes (multi-phase).
Ability to report on project-level revenue, costs, labor efficiency, and margin.
Ability to analyze estimated vs actual cost, labor hours, and parts usage at the project level.
Ability to automate revenue recognition and invoicing based on project percentage complete (labor and parts consumed)
Ability to integrate project management with real-time forecasting and task management
Ability to track invoiced amounts and remaining PO balances for projects
Ability to tie the Bill of Materials to Field Service consumption so technicians can only select from approved project parts.
Ability to return unused parts from a project to inventory with accurate cost reversal.
Ability to support both van inventory workflows and warehouse to project direct staging with consistent cost and audit tracking.
Ability to track  partial installation and device-level activation
Ability to maintain a centralized repository for project documents and handover packages
Ability to support flexible project closure and reopening with controlled phases
Ability to generate and maintain Schedule of Values (SOV) at the project line level and update SOV without losing billing audit history.
Ability to calculate and track retainage held, released, and remaining balance at the project level.
Ability to automatically transition projects records to to service records upon project closeout
Ability to automate and streamline the transition from installation to service contracts, including tracking partial completions and warranty start dates.
Ability to associate "customer assets" to service records
Ability to integrate with the CRM to create service orders linked to service records
Ability to integrate with Field Services to capture labor and parts reported by Technicians to complete service orders
Ability to allocate labor cost (wages + burden) to projects or service records.
Ability to differentiate billable vs. non-billable labor time.
Ability for supervisors to review and approve technician time and service logs prior to billing.
Ability to associate and record materials/supplies consumed during service to the service record
Ability to prorate first/last month billing based on service start/stop dates.
Ability to automatically restart billing when service resumes.
Ability to support asset lifecycle tracking and warranty management
Ability to report on Monthly Recurring Revenue Rollforward (Beginning RMR, New RMR, Escalation, Attrition, Ending RMR)
Ability to support building ownership changes with future owner fields and service hold
Ability to flag subsidized or discounted projects for revenue allocation

Ability to invoice customers based on:
- Total project value
-Percent complete or milestone achievement (including cost-to-cost, hours, or quantity-based progress).
Ability to support both internal (intercompany) and external customer billing flows using the same project structure.
Ability to attach timesheets, labor detail, parts/material usage, and subcontractor invoices to billing support packages.
Ability to invoice inventory and materials directly to the project/customer.
Ability to automatically calculate tax on invoices.
Ability to generate complex billing formats (AIA, T&M, fixed price, retainage-based)
Ability to create custom invoice templates/formats and assign default invoice template to each customer
Ability to include labor/parts detail within invoices.
Ability to add billing comments / scope notes to invoices.
Ability to manage project billing schedules (SOV, milestones, progress draws).
Ability to track billed vs unbilled value.
Ability to support multi-address/multi-contact billing and consolidated invoices across projects
Ability to split invoice lines into services vs materials.
Ability to support usage-based or metered billing methods (door access counts, etc).
Ability to automate state-specific tax calculation for labor and parts
Capabilities related to customer portal for invoice history, reprints, and service reports that can be accessed by customers
Ability to itemize recurring revenue invoices with equipment-level detail and escalator history
Ability to support AIA billing with automatic schedule of values and integration to AIA portals
Ability to enforce billing readiness checks (labor posted, parts posted, approvals complete) before an invoice can be generated.
Ability to route draft invoices for PM / Sales / Finance approval before posting.
Ability to calculate prorated recurring billing for partial monthly service activation.
Ability to record receipts from check, credit card, ACH and wire.
Ability to integrate with bank lockbox / file feed to import and auto-create cash batches.
Ability to apply lump sum payments to several invoices
Ability to feed cash batches from various banks direct into ERP
Ability to auto-match cash to invoices using amount, reference #, customer, or remittance advice.
Ability to manually apply cash when auto-match exceptions occur.
Ability for customers to access a portal, view open invoices, make payments, and have payments reflected real-time.
Ability to configure and maintain granular access controls within the customer payment portal
Ability to view and report invoices in “cash in transit” status.
Ability to generate / send customer statements electronically.
Ability to un-apply and re-apply payments to invoices after posting.
Ability to flag and manage overpayments.
Ability to apply overpayments to open invoices or hold them as credit.
Ability to generate refunds to customers for overpayments.
Ability to automatically place customer accounts on service hold when unresolved past-due balance exceeds credit threshold.
Ability to view A/R aging by customer, project, region, segment, and account owner.
Ability to configure automated past-due notifications and follow-up reminders based on aging thresholds.
Ability to establish A/R performance dashboards with visibility to open AR, WIP (unbilled), and disputed balances.
Ability to establish A/R reserve for written-off amounts
Ability to view total cash receipts including applied, partially applied, and unapplied balances.
Ability to write-off customer balances.
Ability to route write-off requests through review and approval workflow.
Ability to configure multi-level write-off approval routing across Finance and Operations.
Ability to notify approvers when write-off requests are pending action.
Ability to establish write-off codes to indicate the reason a write-off has occurred (e.g. customer concession, bad debt)
Ability to support automated dunning with configurable stages and VIP exceptions
Ability to segment collections strategies based on customer type (Broker, Building Owner, Property Manager, Direct Contract).
Ability to track collection notes, disputes, call logs, and escalation history in the customer record.
Ability to generate revenue schedules based on contract start, billing frequency, contract term, and service activation date.
Ability to systematically recognize deferred revenue monthly and maintain contract liability balance.
Ability to true-up revenue based on revised estimates-to-complete.
Ability to record journal entries related to revenue recognition and billing to the appropriate sub-ledger accounts in an automated manner
Ability to systematically identify and record bad debt.
Ability to support revenue recognition based on project progress (% complete, milestone, or labor + materials consumed).
Ability to align revenue recognition to the Schedule of Values (SOV) when applicable.
Ability to report on revenue recognition forecast by contract, customer, site, and service type.
Ability to run revenue reports by state, customer, service type, and region.
Ability to report on A/R Aging with drill-down to site or portfolio level.
Ability to report Bad Debt
Ability to run customer / region consolidated reporting
Ability to produce utilization reports by technician, team, or crew (actual vs. scheduled hours).
Ability to analyze project profitability by customer, project, region, and service type.
Ability to generate multi-site portfolio reporting with asset and revenue metrics
Ability to report inventory turnover, shrinkage, and materials usage by project, warehouse, and technician.
Ability to report on SLA performance (on-time %, missed visits, rework %, service response time).
Ability to maintain and update tax rates by state, county, and city.
Ability to integrate with an external tax engine to automatically calculate sales tax and manage exemption validation.
Ability for the system to comply with SOC 1 and SOC 2 control requirements.
Ability to support vendor classification (material supplier, subcontractor/cleaning partner, professional services).
Ability to qualify and maintian preferred vendors
Ability to define and maintain vendor parent/child or multi-location vendor relationships.
Ability to create, modify, and maintain vendor master data.
Ability to establish approval workflows for new vendor onboarding and vendor record changes.
Ability to view linked transactions, invoices, purchase orders, project assignments, and payments at the vendor level.
Ability to add internal notes, compliance reminders, or vendor management documentation to vendor records.
Ability to scan and provide image of invoice to approvers
Ability to store and attach vendor documentation (W-9, COI, certifications, background checks) and track expiration dates.
Ability to automatically flag, place on hold, or prevent vendor use when COI or compliance documentation expires.
Ability to track contractors and produce 1099 tax forms and vendor detail reports
Ability to store vendor / 1099 licensing and certification information
Ability to manage and support onboarding, maintenance, and approval of vendors
Ability to automate vendor onboarding with compliance and approval workflows
Ability to support multiple payment methods (Checks, ACH, P-Card etc.) and payment terms (i.e. prepaid, Net 30, 2/10 Net 30 etc.)
Ability to identify and prevent duplicate vendor records
Ability to assign and manage vendor payment terms, discount eligibility, and preferred payment methods.
Ability to set up an intercompany vendor(s)
Ability to configure system to assign certain categories or tags to vendors that would enable reporting and capability to drill down
Ability to associate subcontractor/vendor charges to a project for cost tracking and billing alignment.
Ability to prevent vendor selection in purchasing or invoice workflows based on compliance hold, performance score, or manual override flag.
Ability to identify and prevent duplicate vendor records across entities/regions.
Ability to systematically generate purchase requisitions
Ability to enforce purchase requisition and approval for indirect spend
Ability to route purchase requisitions for approval based on delegation of authority (role, region, spend threshold).
Ability to convert approved purchase requisitions to purchase orders.
Ability to generate, send, and maintain purchase orders to vendors.
Ability to systematically approve requisitions based on an approval matrix
Ability to approve Requisitions via email link/mobile app
Ability to set up automated, tiered approval routing based on user role and purchase amount (delegation of authority considerations)
Ability to integrate with the CRM to track initiated purchase requests for projects
Ability to generate a purchase order from a purchase requisition
Ability to manually generate purchase orders
Ability to process and maintain blanket POs
Ability to schedule recurring / standing POs for consumables replenishment.
Ability to create a Purchase Order to capture the terms and conditions for a long term future purchasing engagement with a supplier.
Ability to systematically approve POs based on an approval matrix
Ability to associate purchase orders directly with project account for cost visibility.
Ability to receive goods into multiple receiving locations (warehouse, regional storage, customer site).
Ability to flag discrepancies between ordered and received quantities and route exceptions for review.
Ability to approve POs via email link/mobile app
Ability to provide a view of purchases pending approval
Ability to identify open POs for management (e.g., release, close)
Ability to close purchase orders based on various criteria (i.e., dates, vendor, company, purchase category etc.)
Support for recurring purchase schedules
Ability to associate POs to inventory SKUs for resale tracking
Ability to trigger reorder suggestions based on usage history / minimum stock thresholds.
Ability to maintain supplier catalogs with contracted item pricing.
Ability to track spend by vendor, region, project, and service line.
Ability to intake vendor invoices via email upload, scanner, or electronic invoice file.
Ability to automatically perform 3-way match between invoice, PO, and receipt
Ability to route exceptions from 3-way match (price/quantity mismatch) for review and correction.
Ability to host dynamic invoice approval workflows tailored based on various criteria including dollar value, cost center, and invoice type (PO vs. non-PO Invoice)
Ability to scan an invoice into ERP to extract and populate key invoice fields (invoice #, dates, amounts, etc.)
Ability to code invoices scanned into the ERP into the proper GL account
Ability to store invoice attachments, proof of service documents, and site manager approvals directly linked to the invoice record.
Ability for invoice coding to be modified during approval workflow with tracked audit history.
Ability to manually code/update GL codes with single or multiple items
Ability to apply default GL coding rules based on vendor, item, or service type
Ability to identify and prevent duplicate invoices based on invoice number, vendor, and date.
Ability to save frequently used and most recently used expense categories & GL accounts; make available for easy use
Ability to assign GL codes by selecting expense categories for each individual expense line item and by the date of the expense.
Ability to utilize ERP OCR or AI capabilities or integrate with an invoice scanning/OCR/conversion system
Ability to route AP invoices for approval based on region, spend threshold, and vendor type (subcontractor vs material vendor).
Ability to apply partial approval rules where regional manager approves service confirmation and finance approves coding.
Ability to designate an invoice (vendor) as auto-approve (e.g. utility invoices)
Ability to generate automated notifications to Approvers that there are invoices pending review
Ability to utilize mobile devices for reviewers/approvers to review/approve invoices
Ability to create system generated escalation emails sent to reviewers/approvers/supervisors when invoices are not approved based on pre-determined time frames
Ability to void payments
Allow read only access to invoice history for staff not requiring approver rights
Ability to systematically delegate approval responsibilities in case an approver is on PTO or Leave
Ability to reroute invoice approvals if an invoice is not approved within the designated timeframe.
Ability to add comments on invoices to communicate discrepancies or adjustments required
Ability for an approver to approve, modify, place on hold, decline, and provide commentary (e.g. partial payment, pose questions to AP) on invoices
Ability to provide alerts on matching exceptions including categories of exceptions
Ability to provide dashboard reporting and aging of exceptions and assign owners/responsibility
Ability to attach invoice images to transactions
Ability to attach and store scanned invoice and receipt documentation on respective records in ERP
Ability to annotate invoice coding exceptions for audit trail and training/reduction monitoring.
Ability to remit vendor payments via Checks, Direct Deposit, ACH, Wires, etc.
Ability to generate vendor payment batches by entity, bank account, payment method, or region.
Ability to generate Positive Pay files and transmit to banks.
Ability to pay vendors in batch
Ability to roll up multiple invoices for a vendor to be paid on a single payment
Ability to separate payment approval workflow for subcontractor invoices vs. materials vendors.
Ability to track and report subcontractor invoice spend by building, region, and contract portfolio.
Ability to separate payment batches by payment method (e.g. check, ACH, wire, etc.)
Ability to separate and manage multiple disbursement bank accounts by legal entity or region.
Ability to run payment proposals and determine value of cash discounts available
Ability to route payment proposals for approvals
Ability to integrate Concur / Expense settlement files directly into AP payment proposals, preserving employee / cardholder details.
Ability to automatically post payment accounting entries to the general ledger.
Ability to apply early payment discounts based on terms and show discount impact prior to payment run.
Ability to report payment on hold by reason code and comments
Ability to report payment activity by vendor, region, cost center, or contract portfolio.
Ability to generate remittance notices for payments and send to vendor via email
Ability to void payments and automatically reverse the associated accounting entry.
Ability to withhold or hold payment pending building / service confirmation from operations or field service.
Ability to distribute payment remittance notifications to vendors via email.
Ability to perform receipt of materials and equipment against Purchase Orders, including quantity, date, and location.
Ability to route service receipts to building operations / field supervisors for confirmation before invoice approval.
Ability to note partial receipt, incomplete service, or incorrect delivery details.
Ability to attach delivery documents, photos, project completion notes, or proof of work performed to the receipt record.
Ability to escalate disputed receipts to purchasing or operations for review.
Ability to report on open receipts, receipts pending approval, and receipts tied to disputed invoices.
Ability to integrate with barcode / QR scanning where physical inventory exists (warehouse sites only).
Ability to create workflow for missed deliveries, damaged goods, or work not performed, including routing to responsible parties.
Ability to support receipts across multiple projects and locations and link receipts to the correct project / contract.
Ability to integrate approved expense reports from Concur into ERP AP module, preserving employee, department, project, and GL coding.
Ability to import P-Card transaction settlement files into ERP for journal creation and cost allocation.
Ability to maintain a mapping table between expense categories in Concur and GL accounts in ERP.
Ability to associate P-Cards to employees, departments, regions, and cost centers for reporting and audit.
Ability for ERP to store and reference receipt attachments sent from Concur or Card Statement Feeds.
Ability to flag disputed charges, personal spend, or unauthorized spend and route for review.
Ability to generate reporting: spend by category, cost center, region, cardholder, and vendor.
Ability to automatically create AP or JE postings from the expense feed.
Ability to exclude or segregate travel expenses from cost-to-complete calculations
Ability to support AI-driven expense classification and receipt enforcement
Ability to support integration updates when new departments, cost centers, GL accounts, or employees are added.
Ability to reconcile Corporate Card statements and flag mismatches or missing receipts.
Ability to provide a view of consolidated aging (all entities) with ability to drill down by vendor and legal entity
Ability to produce vendor history and AP aging by vendor reporting
Ability to provide dashboard reporting and aging of invoice exceptions and assign owners/responsibility
Ability to report on subcontractor spend vs. approved budget at the project level
Ability to report on open Purchase Orders, including partially received and unreceived balances.
Ability to report on Goods/Service Received Not Yet Invoiced (GRNI) and link to accruals at month-end.
Ability to track and report on invoice exceptions and disputes, including aging, reason codes, and responsible owners.
Ability to report on vendor payment holds with reason codes, dates, and responsible approver.
Ability to generate reports based on various purchasing attributes (i.e. Purchase Category, Vendor, GL Account number etc.)
Ability to provide cash forecast reporting/historical vendor payments trending
Ability to report on cash requirements for scheduled vendor payments (weekly payables forecast).
Ability to report on goods received but not invoiced
Ability to generate a vendor scorecard to evaluate vendor performance
Ability to produce PO reports at detail and summary levels with the ability to generate dashboard reports
Ability to generate other standard AP reports, including payment summaries and spend by vendor analyses.
Ability to report on P-Card transactions by employee, department, region, expense type, and vendor. Generate customizable reports for expense analysis, budgeting, etc.
Ability to reconcile Concur expense reimbursement totals to ERP posted entries for close & audit.
Ability to generate vendor performance scorecards, including timeliness, accuracy, quality of service, and dispute rates.
Ability to export reports in multiple formats, including Excel and PDF.
Ability to schedule recurring report distribution to designated approvers or leadership groups.
Ability to maintain items with standard attributes (description, unit of measure, category, vendor, cost).
Ability to define parent–child item relationships to support product variants (finish, configuration, etc.).
Ability to maintain alternate / substitute parts for stockout situations.
Ability to break down, store, and track inventory as SKUs/KPNs.
Ability to maintain unit of measure conversions.
Ability to track and calculate landed cost, including freight, tariffs, handling, and labor.
Ability to support kit assembly to combine multiple items (camera + SD card + bracket) into a single finished item.
Ability to maintain flexible costing methods (FIFO, standard cost, or weighted average).
Ability to receive drop-shipped goods and assign to the correct project.
Ability to integrate material usage from field service / project closeout back into ERP inventory.
Ability to integrate item records, kitting, and pricing with the CPQ system
Ability to track inventory commitments to projects before actual issuance.
Ability to track partial usage of bulk materials and retain remaining quantity rather than expensing the entire item to a project.
Ability to set reorder points, safety stock, and lead times to trigger replenishment.
Ability to run light demand planning based on usage and installation pipeline.
Ability to generate system-driven purchase requisitions when inventory drops below replenishment thresholds.
Ability to track inventory across multiple warehouses and regions.
Ability to track technician van inventory as inventory-holding locations — with visibility into usage and replenishment.
System capability to support barcode scanning and automation for receiving and inventory tracking
Ability to configure flexible warehouse management processes that accommodate regional differences
Ability to manage inventory transfers between regional warehouses, van sites, and project locations
Ability to integrate warehouse and inventory data with field service operations
Ability to track bin / location inside warehouse
Ability to manage RMA / returns workflows for damaged/incorrect shipments and record credits issued.
Ability to report on inventory quantity on hand, committed, in transit, and available to allocate.
Ability to report on inventory usage by project for margin analysis.
Ability to report on inventory aging and slow-moving items.
Ability to track purchase price variance (PPV) by vendor and item.
Ability to integrate with a CPM / Planning system (Planful or other platforms)
Ability to integrate with a self-service tool to create dashboards and visualizations
Ability to create budgets at the Entity, Region, and Project levels
Ability to roll up  budgets into a consolidated budget view
Ability to configure approval workflows for budgets
Ability for a system-based collaborative and interactive budgeting and forecasting process
Ability to define user access for creating and editing budgets and forecasts
Ability to revise and analyze budget and forecasts during specified periods
Ability to release working versions of the budget and forecast to defined users
Ability to view real-time status of key tasks in centralized dashboard
Ability to track budget and forecast version changes with an audit trail
Ability to perform actual to actual and actual to budget comparisons on prior time periods: month, quarter, years
Ability to take and maintain budget and forecast snapshots to memorialize historical budget views
Ability to integrate GL actuals data within system for automation of budget to actuals analysis
Ability for drilldown capabilities to the transaction and invoice level
Ability to maintain and archive core budget drivers and assumptions within budgeting, planning, and forecasting calculations within the system
Ability to automatically distribute budgets to designated cost center leads on a monthly basis
Ability to run P&Ls and revenue forecasts at both state and corporate levels
Ability to report on actuals vs budget and/or forecasts
Ability to re-forecast or adjust current forecasts
Ability to prepare multi-year budgets and forecasts within the system at different time periods including monthly, quarterly, and annual budgets and forecasts.
Support for inventory demand forecasting based on historical usage and seasonality
Ability to integrate the ERP with CRM and Field Service for workforce planning
Ability to archive previous workforce planning forecasts
Ability to perform top-side forecast adjustments to workforce planning by state
Ability to integrate scheduling data for labor forecasting by project
Ability to build budgets by customer or contract
Ability to track profitability at the customer/contract level
Ability to forecast contract renewals and expected customer churn
Ability to model pricing changes on long-term contracts
Ability to allocate overhead costs to customer contracts for margin analysis
Ability to modify guidelines and metrics for selected KPIs
Ability to add and centralize commentary on KPI trends or variances
Ability for only defined users to add comments and modify KPI guidelines
Ability to have automatic distribution of proposed KPIs and reports to defined users
Ability to define security/view access to KPI Dashboard by user and group
Ability to auto-create and pull relevant KPI reports from KPI Dashboard
Ability for prepare end-user specific dashboards which can be customized for user and role
Ability for users to independently run pre-established reports on state performance using dashboard functionality.
Ability to standardized report templates for consistency in pulling key data points (e.g. state/entity revenue)
Ability to view real-time financial KPIs within ERP and KPI Dashboard including historical trends
KPIs for service quality: missed visits, rework %, on-time arrival
KPIs for product sales: sell-through rate, stockouts, returns
Support for Board and Executive summary packages with snapshots, comments, and trends
Automated forecast vs. prior year variance narratives with drill-through
